item.description:
"Who's the fairest of them all?": The Judge White Years


Red Huntress and the wolf


The Last Dwarf






Our last discussion of favorite authors, novels and story making was a lot of fun.

For this Meetup, we'll continue where we left off.

Which was a home work assignment!

Take a classic children's story or fairy tale, and use it as the basis for a new story in a different genre. Perhaps a courtroom drama? A mystery? A tragic romance? Or?

You can bring your proposal to discuss, or even bring a scene to read to the group.



The Meetup will be divided into 3 parts:

Story making, where we'll discuss reconstituted fairy tales and collaborate on writing a short scene for a novel. For the scene, we'll focus on a serious dramatic story you might find in the middle of a novel. What are the characters? What are the issues? How did we get to this point in the story? The group will work this out in a lightly moderated discussion.

In the second part of the Meetup, we'll discuss what fiction we are reading currently.

If we have time, we'll go on to the third part, which is a surprise!








Meetup location: The Watertown Public Library has been kind enough to allow us to use one of their meeting rooms. This will allow for a discussion without a lot of outside noise. The meeting room is on the second floor, it is the Lucia Mastrangelo Meeting Room.

Time: 1PM - 4PM

Parking: Behind the library is some parking which should be free on Sunday.
Also, behind the CVS is a large parking lot.
item.how_to_find_us: Find us up on the second floor in the glass meeting room with the tables and white board.
item.name: Story Making: Reconstituted Fairy Tales
